solution: ## Solutions to Inverse Matrix Method Exercises
### Exercise 5: Inverse Method vs Other Methods
**a)** Gauss elimination: More efficient computationally, modifies matrix in place
Inverse method: Requires computing full inverse, uses more memory, conceptually clear
**b)** Cramer's rule: Computes each variable separately using determinants
Inverse method: Computes all variables at once, better for multiple RHS
Use inverse method when: same A with multiple b, conceptual clarity needed
Use Gauss elimination when: single system, efficiency important
Use Cramer's rule when: small systems, determinant interpretation needed
